about.policy:
La vida privada en Internet es un derecho. Por qué deberíamos aceptar que no se le harían en nuestra vida cotidiana (offline) ? Desde muchos años, empresas privadas como Google, Facebook, etc... Así como los departamentos gubernamentales nos espían y recogen información sobre nosotros , todos los días, en la red. Sin embargo, hemos los medios de contrarrestar este espionaje de masa con la criptografía pero bastantes pocos planes nos permitan de protegernos adecuadamente. Pero, hoy, tenemos la suerte de tener una alternativa segura por nuestros correos : ProtonMail, que permite el cifrado de principio a fin de estos últimos.
Es en esta ética que tenemos empezado el desarrollo de Muonium para proporcionarle una alternativa por el almacenamiento de sus documentos en la red de forma segura . Nuestra política nos oblig de cuantificar desde sus navigador Internet sus archivos dirigiéndose los únicos auténticoss propietario de de estos.
about.PaulLife: Paul es un colegial apasionado por muchas ciencas así que la informática. Gestiona los servidores, así que, asistido por Romain, el equipo de Muonium. La vida privada en la red es un tema querido y cercano al corazón en serio. Sin mencionar que está muy interesado en los mangas, animes, dramas, el Japón, así que el open source, el Libre .

adventure.mouseDescription: Pase el ratón sobre una burbuja para mostrar información
adventure.phase1:
This first phase is to create a complete website called 'features' for the project presentation in general, developers and additional informations about security.

Expected launching date : End January 2016
adventure.phase2:
The second phase involves the development of management interface for your files. The interface will only include the basic features (such encryption will be of course the first to be established). Once completed, the limited beta will be launched. It will include about fifty people.

Expected launching date : December 2016
adventure.phase3:
The third phase involves the purchase of our own servers and open public beta with additional features (in addition to the basic features). Our servers will support about 1,000 to 2,000 people.

Expected launching date : Uncertain
adventure.phase4:
The fourth phase is the release of a completely stable version of the interface (probably with performance improvements, simplifications of certain features, etc ...). The launch of the first stable version will come with a purchase of several servers with high storage capacity.

Expected launching date : Uncertain
adventure.phase5:
The fifth and final phase will mainly launch other projects under the name Kantum Technologies and the financing of new servers. The interface will go through a strict analysis to significantly improve the user experience.

Expected launching date : Uncertain

donate.whyDonateTxt:
Our team is composed of students, not professionals strictly speaking. So, we are not paid by any job. If we need money, we must devote our time to work, which's less time to work on Muonium or on our studies.
If by your donations, we manage to strike a balance and we don't necessarily need to work to support us, then we can devote ourselves even more to the development of Muonium.

help.losePwd: I lost my password, how can I recover it ?
help.losePwdAns:
If this is your identification password, then click on "Forgot password?" on the login page. Your password will be reset and an email will be sent with a temporary password.
However, if this is your decryption password, it's impossible for us to redefine one and you must consider that all your files are lost.
help.whoCanAccessMyFilesAns: Only you can access your files. Without technical terms, you need a key (the "passphrase") to encrypt and decrypt your files. Thus, nobody, not even we, can access your files, you apart.
help.howEncryptedAns: Your files are encrypted end-to-end thanks to SJCL at your browser using your personal key, also decrypted in your browser. Thus, data that are sent are already encrypted and nobody else except you can decrypt them.
help.howFunded: How is funded Muonium ? Do you receive some help from companies ?
help.howFundedAns: No, Muonium policy is to not belong to any company (except ours), not to receive help from big companies, in order to not jeopardize our privacy policy, etc... Thus, Muonium is only funded through your donations. You can take a ride in the 'Donate' section if you are interested.
help.helpTerrorism: Are you trying to help terrorists or evil organizations ?
help.helpTerrorismAns: No, we advocate privacy, certainly helping the world get a better privacy, we unwittingly helping terrorism. But we're in the same situation as ProtonMail. In any case, even if we wouldn't develop Muonium, terrorists and any other person or group of people will encrypt their data.
help.anotherQuestionAns: Our FAQ will be updated as we receive new questions. You can contact us at : <b>muonium [AT] protonmail [DOT] ch

security.communicationsEncryptionTxt:
Muonium uses TLS 1.2 technology with a certificate generated by Let's Encrypt to secure communications between your devices and servers. With this technology, the information you send (your username, password, etc ...) and receive (personal information, etc ...) are encrypted using an algorithm named AES-256 allowing an encryption by AES - 256 bits.
So, even if your communications are intercepted, they can't be decrypted and no one can steal the information in transit between you and the servers.
security.filesEncryptionTxt: We use end-to-end encryption. This means that whatever the stage (upload, storage, download), your file will still be encrypted. Thus, if someone intercept the communications, the attacker will never read your files. The encryption algorithm used is AES with SJCL (which is a complete and open source implementation of AES) which allows a 256 bits encryption (equivalent of more RSA 2048). When creating an account, the user defines one personal passphrase (it's a password) in order to encrypt and decrypt his files. With this principle, we can't decrypt your files. When you are logging, your passphrase will be stored in your browser to enable the encryption and decryption locally. This keeps the file encrypted at any level (client, Internet, server).
security.EELaws: Under the European and Estonian laws
security.EELawsTxt: Estonian cryptography laws aren't restrictive, that's why Muonium will be deployed in Estonia.
security.tripleAuthTxt:
Only you can access to your files. That is why we have developed a authentication system with 3 layers. The principle is quite simple: You enter your login/mail and password and submit, this is the first security layer. Once you're logged, you need to enter your passphrase to be able to decrypt your key, then allows the decryption of your files, this corresponds to the second layer. But we thought that an additional layer provides more security. After your passphrase, a mail with a code will be send, you need to enter the received code on the page to be totally logged. All this may be a little long, but strengthens the security of your account.
This system is inspired by the double-authentification made by some sites like Gmail or Facebook.
